etymology.description: Depicts a stroke going down to the left
etymology.interpretation: 丿(piě, "slash") represents a basic stroke used in writing Chinese characters, symbolizing movement or falling in a slanting direction.

examples.chinese: 写字时(寫字時)，要注意丿的姿势(要注意丿的姿勢)。
examples.pinyin: Xiězì shí, yào zhùyì piě de zīshì.
examples.english: When writing, pay attention to the posture of the slash stroke.

examples.chinese: 这幅书法作品中(這幅書法作品中)，笔画之间存在着独特的丿运用(筆畫之間存在著獨特的丿運用)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè fú shūfǎ zuòpǐn zhōng, bǐhuà zhījiān cúnzài zhe dútè de piě yùnyòng.
examples.english: In this calligraphy work, there is a unique use of the slash stroke among the brush strokes.
